channel.title: Comments on: Boxing above your weight – Chris Horn

item.title: By: Eamon Leonard
item.dc:creator: Eamon Leonard
item.content:encoded:
“A paradox resulting from the small and open Irish economy is that Irish technology driven start-ups have to think globally first, not later;”

This is a great point. Something we realised within a month of starting up in Oct ’08 was that Ireland was too small for our offering. Naturally, we looked to London first, and got up and running there in March.

I would also wholeheartedly agree on the point about partners. It’s not impossible to do a startup on your own, but it’s got to be tough. Having two other partners to drive the company with me and a fourth in the wings has been a great help. Knowing that you’re working towards shared goals with guys who you trust and have your back is, I feel, a key component to making a startup a success.
